eligibility:
Minimum Eligibility:
Students pursuing International curriculum must note that eligibility is according to AIU stipulations:
Applicants pursuing IB curriculum must have 3 HL and 3 SL with 24 credits.
Applicants pursuing GCE / Edexcel must have a minimum of 3 A levels with a grade not less than C.
why_choose: Why choose this course? Theoretical Robustness Experiential Learning Experience Dynamic Teaching and Evaluation System Academia-Industry Connect Research-based Curriculum Well-connected Alumni Network
what_learn: What you will learn? Economic Theories: Students delve into foundational concepts and theories, learning to analyze market dynamics. Policy Analysis: They examine government interventions, assessing their impacts on sustainable development. Quantitative Skills: Economics majors gain proficiency in data analysis, essential for making informed decisions. Global Perspective: Students will gain a broader understanding of the global economy and its impact on societies and markets. Research Skills: Students will develop the ability to analyze and interpret data to address economic questions and contribute to policy-related knowledge. Critical Thinking: They will develop the ability to analyze complex economic issues and think critically to propose solutions.
modules: Modules Microeconomic Theory I & II Economic History of India from 1750 to 1947 Mathematical Economics-I & II Statistics for Economic Analysis – I & II Institutions and Informal Economy Economics of Corruption Year 1 English Language and Composition Designing Policies for Sustainable Development Democracy and Economy Language and Contemporary Society Basic Excel Environmental Studies Holistic Education – I & II Macroeconomic Theory I & II Regional Economics Fundamentals of Economic Growth and Development I & II Institutional Economics Language Political Economy of India Economics of Law Year 2 Public Economics Digital literacy Internship Holistic Education – III & IV International Economics History of Economic Thought Urban Development and Planning Introduction to Econometrics Swayam Experiential Learning (Field Visit Project) Indian Economy Year 3 Non-linear Econometrics Analysis Money and Banking Foundations of Agricultural Economics Education and Development Data Analysis using SPSS/JAMOVI Data Analysis using STATA/R Understanding India Research Methodology in Economics Behavioural Economics Applied Econometrics Financial Economics Gender Economics Urban Economics Research Proposal in Economics Academic Writing for Economics Year 4 Environmental Economics: Theory and Application Industrial Economics Labour Economics and Public Policy Health Economics Seminar Presentation Research Manuscript in Economics
career: Career prospects Placement in reputed companies as economic analysts, data scientists, and business analysts. Our students were placed in companies such as Goldman Sachs, D.E.Shaw, PWC, Accenture, ICICI bank, Tresvista, Everest, etc. Our students were placed in roles such as Operations analyst, Financial analyst, Research and investment analyst, Analyst CFO, Consultant, HR manager, etc. Opportunities in national and international research institutes as research associates and research analysts. Opportunities for future academic programmes, such as MA and PhD, in national and international universities. The programme equips students for government jobs and policy analysis roles.
